overview.title: Understanding Tarot Cards
overview.description: Tarot cards are a powerful tool for divination, self-reflection, and spiritual guidance. A traditional tarot deck consists of 78 cards divided into two main categories: the Major Arcana and the Minor Arcana.

major_arcana.title: The Major Arcana
major_arcana.subtitle: The Greater Mysteries
major_arcana.description: The Major Arcana consists of 22 cards that represent significant life events, spiritual lessons, and archetypal energies. These cards carry the most weight in a reading and often indicate major turning points or profound spiritual insights.
characteristics: Represent major life themes and spiritual lessons
Indicate significant turning points and transformations
Carry more weight in readings than Minor Arcana
Often represent archetypal energies and universal experiences
Can indicate long-term influences and karmic patterns
major_arcana.numbering: Cards are numbered 0-21, with The Fool as 0 and The World as 21
themes: Major life decisions and turning points

minor_arcana.title: The Minor Arcana
minor_arcana.subtitle: The Lesser Mysteries
minor_arcana.description: The Minor Arcana consists of 56 cards divided into four suits, each representing different aspects of daily life and human experience. These cards provide practical guidance and reflect the everyday situations we encounter.
characteristics: Represent daily life and practical matters
Provide specific guidance for everyday situations
Reflect immediate influences and short-term energies
Offer practical advice and actionable insights
Show the details and nuances of life circumstances

structure.court_cards: Page, Knight, Queen, King (4 cards per suit)

wands.name: Wands
wands.description: Wands represent creativity, passion, energy, and spiritual growth. They are associated with inspiration, ambition, and the spark of new ideas.

cups.name: Cups
cups.description: Cups represent emotions, relationships, intuition, and matters of the heart. They are associated with love, compassion, and emotional fulfillment.

swords.name: Swords
swords.description: Swords represent intellect, communication, challenges, and mental clarity. They are associated with thoughts, decisions, and the power of the mind.

pentacles.name: Pentacles
pentacles.description: Pentacles represent material wealth, practical matters, health, and physical manifestation. They are associated with abundance, security, and tangible results.

number_cards.title: Number Cards (Ace-10)
number_cards.description: Number cards represent specific energies and lessons associated with their numerical value. Each number carries its own symbolic meaning and energy.
number_cards.structure: Each suit contains cards numbered Ace (1) through 10
number_cards.significance: Represent specific life lessons, energies, and situations

court_cards.title: Court Cards (Page, Knight, Queen, King)
court_cards.description: Court cards represent people, personalities, or aspects of yourself. They can indicate actual people in your life or qualities you need to embody.
court_cards.structure: Each suit contains four court cards: Page, Knight, Queen, King
court_cards.significance: Represent people, personalities, or aspects of character

upright_vs_reversed.title: Upright vs. Reversed Cards
upright_vs_reversed.description: Cards can appear upright or reversed in a reading, each offering different insights and meanings.
upright_vs_reversed.upright: Represents the card's natural energy and positive expression
upright_vs_reversed.reversed: Indicates blocked energy, internal reflection, or alternative interpretations

interpretation_tips: Consider the card's position in the spread
Look at surrounding cards for context
Trust your intuition and personal connection
Consider both traditional meanings and personal symbolism
Remember that tarot is a tool for guidance, not prediction
